intro: Gagea arvensis f. obtusiflora, commonly known as the blunt-flowered grass violet, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asparagaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the genus Gagea, with the specific form obtusiflora distinguished by its rounded, bluntly shaped flower petals.
